seriesJson.title: Exploring the child's world
seriesJson.description: Interviews with delinquent and disturbed young people who are encouraged to discuss their experiences and express feelings. To protect individuals, each program is a re-creation of an actual interview using different names and places.

node.title: Bad companions
node.description: This program focuses on how the negative influence of other children can lead to a child's delinquency.

node.title: The quiet child
node.description: This program focuses on how quiet and introverted children can fall into delinquency.

node.title: The lonely boy
node.description: This program focuses on how loneliness and isolation can be at the root of juvenile delinquency.

node.title: School problem
node.description: This program focuses on how troubles in school can be at the root of juvenile delinquency.

node.title: Nagging parents
node.description: This program focuses on "nagging parents" and their role in a child's problems.

node.title: Religious factors in upset
node.description: This program explores religious factors that could be involved in children's delinquency.

node.title: Anomie
node.description: This program focuses on anomie, the concept that society doesn't provide enough moral guidance to children and others.

node.title: Differential association
node.description: This program focuses on differential association, a theory that proposes that children's negative behaviors are learned from others.

node.title: Personality traits
node.description: This program focuses on the personality traits of delinquent children.

node.title: The presenting problem
node.description: This program focuses on the "presenting problem," or a situation where a different problem is presented by the child than the one they actually need help with.

node.title: Institutional posture
node.description: This program focuses on "institutional posture" or the concept that some delinquent children don't learn how to cope outside of institutional settings.

node.title: Self defense
node.description: This program looks at howa child's misbehavior can be a form of self defense.
